title: Scrambled Egg

ingredients.text: 15 ML Milk Semi Skim Poly RT 2.27L

children.text: whisk 2 eggs with the milk and cook in the microwave

title: Pastry

children.text: Preheat the oven 180ºC. For the pastry: Cream together 3 eggs and 125 gm sugar add the 300 gm Flora Buttery and mix together gradually add the flour and salt until smooth and leave to rest for 1 hour.

Roll out the pastry to 4mm thick on a lightly floured surface. Cut out 10 11cm circles and 10 8cm circles of pastry. Use the larger circle to line a non stick mini muffin tin and chill. Chill the 8cm circles as these will be the lids.
For the filling: Peel quarter and core the pears and apples then slice thickly into a bowl. Zest and juice the lemon.
Mix together 120 gm sugar (retain a little to sprinkle over later) the cinnamon thelemon juice and zest and stir gently into the pears and apples.
Place the pear and apple slices into the lined muffin tins. Cut the remaining butter into 10 and dot each pie with butter and sprinkle with chopped rosemary.
Place the smaller circles on top of the sliced pears and apples. Seal the edges well. Make a small hole in the top to allow steam to escape.
Egg wash with lightly beaten egg and sprinkle with the remaining sugar.
Bake at 180°c for 30 mins until the fruit is tender and the top is golden brown.

methodText: 1. Preheat the oven 180ºC. For the pastry: Cream together 3 eggs and 125 gm sugar add the 300 gm Flora Buttery and mix together gradually add the flour and salt until smooth and leave to rest for 1 hour. 2. Roll out the pastry to 4mm thick on a lightly floured surface. Cut out 10 11cm circles and 10 8cm circles of pastry. Use the larger circle to line a non stick mini muffin tin and chill. Chill the 8cm circles as these will be the lids. 3. For the filling: Peel quarter and core the pears and apples then slice thickly into a bowl. Zest and juice the lemon. 4. Mix together 120 gm sugar (retain a little to sprinkle over later) the cinnamon thelemon juice and zest and stir gently into the pears and apples. 5. Place the pear and apple slices into the lined muffin tins. Cut the remaining butter into 10 and dot each pie with butter and sprinkle with chopped rosemary. 6. Place the smaller circles on top of the sliced pears and apples. Seal the edges well. Make a small hole in the top to allow steam to escape. 7. Egg wash with lightly beaten egg and sprinkle with the remaining sugar. 8. Bake at 180°c for 30 mins until the fruit is tender and the top is golden brown.

title: Onion Bhajis

children.text: Pre-heat the oven & cook at 170°C until golden brown & crisp. Ensure core temperature has been reached: 75°C ENG / 82°C SCOT.

methodText: 1. Pre-heat the oven & cook at 170°C until golden brown & crisp. Ensure core temperature has been reached: 75°C ENG / 82°C SCOT.

title: Chicken Fajita

ingredients.text: 100 ML Oil Rapeseed Extended Life B/B 20L
20 G Sugar Cane Pure Granulated FT 1KG
1 KG Chicken Supreme S/L UK RT MB 170- 200g
ingredients.item: Chicken Supreme S/L UK RT MB 170- 200g

children.text: Whisk together the oil paprika salt Cajun spice and lemon juice in a large bowl.
Cut the chicken breasts into strips and marinade in the oil over night. Slice the onions and peppers and arrange on a suitable service tray.
Build each portion to order by stir frying the vegetables and chicken strips and placing into a wrap add a little salsa to each portion and roll.
Allow customers to self serve the sour cream.

methodText: 1. Whisk together the oil paprika salt Cajun spice and lemon juice in a large bowl. 2. Cut the chicken breasts into strips and marinade in the oil over night. Slice the onions and peppers and arrange on a suitable service tray. 3. Build each portion to order by stir frying the vegetables and chicken strips and placing into a wrap add a little salsa to each portion and roll. 4. Allow customers to self serve the sour cream.

title: Eat Middle Eastern Fattoush Salad

ingredients.text: 20 G Herb Parsley Flat Leaf Bunch BB 100g
ingredients.item: Herb Parsley Flat Leaf Bunch BB 100g

ingredients.text: 2 EA Bread White Lebanese Khobes 8inch 5s S

children.text: Preheat oven to 160ºC. Chop the lettuce wash and drain well. Cut the cucumber in half scoop the seeds out and cut the cucumber on and angle into slices.
Cut the cherry tomatoes into quarters. Deseed and cut the pepper into fine strips. Thinly slice the radishes. Chop the parsley. Shred and wash the spring onions.
Warm the bread in the oven until slightly crisp. Break the breads into small chunks.
Combine all of the ingredients together and mix well and serve.

methodText: 1. Preheat oven to 160ºC. Chop the lettuce wash and drain well. Cut the cucumber in half scoop the seeds out and cut the cucumber on and angle into slices. 2. Cut the cherry tomatoes into quarters. Deseed and cut the pepper into fine strips. Thinly slice the radishes. Chop the parsley. Shred and wash the spring onions. 3. Warm the bread in the oven until slightly crisp. Break the breads into small chunks. 4. Combine all of the ingredients together and mix well and serve.

title: The Big Breakfast Half Baguette

ingredients.text: 1 KG Baguette White Demi Part Baked
62 G Bacon Crispy Cooked Unsmoked Streaky 1KG
2.5 EA Egg Boiled Hard Free Range
350 G SAUSAGES LINCOLNSHIRE 8S KG BF IMS of Smithfield Ltd 5B87
ingredients.item: SAUSAGES LINCOLNSHIRE 8S KG BF IMS of Smithfield Ltd 5B87

children.text: Cook the baguettes as per manufacturer's instructions. Leave to cool for 30 minutes then cut open.
Cook the sausages to 72*c. Cut the sausages into 3 long slices. Cut the tomatoes into slices then cut each slice in half. Slice the egg.
Spread the mayonnaise onto the base of each baguette. Place the tomatoes on top Place the sliced egg on top of the tomato. Place the sausage and bacon on top of the egg. Season with the pepper.
Cut each baguette in half.

methodText: 1. Cook the baguettes as per manufacturer's instructions. Leave to cool for 30 minutes then cut open. 2. Cook the sausages to 72*c. Cut the sausages into 3 long slices. Cut the tomatoes into slices then cut each slice in half. Slice the egg. 3. Spread the mayonnaise onto the base of each baguette. Place the tomatoes on top Place the sliced egg on top of the tomato. Place the sausage and bacon on top of the egg. Season with the pepper. 4. Cut each baguette in half.

title: Sig Salad Aubergine with Oregano  Parsley Tahini

ingredients.text: 34 G Paste Tahini 1KG Belazu Ingredient Company PA061G
ingredients.item: Paste Tahini 1KG Belazu Ingredient Company PA061G

ingredients.text: 1 G Herb Parsley Flat Leaf Bunch BB 100g
ingredients.item: Herb Parsley Flat Leaf Bunch BB 100g

ingredients.text: 70 G Chilli Red Thai PP 250g Reynolds Catering Supplies Ltd 3603EA
ingredients.item: Chilli Red Thai PP 250g Reynolds Catering Supplies Ltd 3603EA

ingredients.text: 20 G CHILLI RED THAI First Choice Produce Ltd CHILRT
ingredients.item: CHILLI RED THAI First Choice Produce Ltd CHILRT

children.text: Half the aubergine and cut into 12 wedges in total. Season and cover well in olive oil. Roast for 18 minutes at 210*C degrees.
Make the marinade: mix 30g chopped corriander 30g chopped oregano 50g finley chopped red chilli 4 cloves crushed garlic zest and juice of 1 lemon salt and pepper.
When the aubergines are still warm dress with the marinade and leave for 20 minutes then mix gently.
Make the tahini dressing: mix 280g tahini with 200ml water 60ml lemon juice 4 cloves of garlic crushed seasoning. Mix together gently with a spoon and the add 100g chopped parsley.
Layer the salad up alternating with the tahini. Dress the salad with oregano and coriander tops and a drizzle of dressing.

methodText: 1. Half the aubergine and cut into 12 wedges in total. Season and cover well in olive oil. Roast for 18 minutes at 210*C degrees. 2. Make the marinade: mix 30g chopped corriander 30g chopped oregano 50g finley chopped red chilli 4 cloves crushed garlic zest and juice of 1 lemon salt and pepper. 3. When the aubergines are still warm dress with the marinade and leave for 20 minutes then mix gently. 4. Make the tahini dressing: mix 280g tahini with 200ml water 60ml lemon juice 4 cloves of garlic crushed seasoning. Mix together gently with a spoon and the add 100g chopped parsley. 5. Layer the salad up alternating with the tahini. Dress the salad with oregano and coriander tops and a drizzle of dressing.

title: CheeseBurger Kids

ingredients.text: 200 ML Oil Rapeseed Extended Life B/B 20L

children.text: Peel and thinly slice the onions. Add the oil into a pan add the onions. Cook over a medium heat until softened.
Cook the burger on the BBQ colouring on each side until a core temperature of 65*C is achieved.
Serve in the bun with the onions on top.

methodText: 1. Peel and thinly slice the onions. Add the oil into a pan add the onions. Cook over a medium heat until softened. 2. Cook the burger on the BBQ colouring on each side until a core temperature of 65*C is achieved. 3. Serve in the bun with the onions on top.

title: BBQ Brisket

ingredients.text: 50 ML Oil Rapeseed Extended Life KTC 5L
80 ML Sauce Smoked Hickory BBQ 5L SAUBBQHIC5L

children.text: For the rub; Mix all the spices sugar and salt together in a small bowl and set aside.

For the brisket; Trim down any think layers of fat then rub the spice rub all over the brisket. In a pot add 500ml water the tomato paste veg stock heat and whisk to incorporate. Place the brisket in a gastro tray fat side down with the roughly diced onion tomato stock and cover with a lid or foil.
Roast in the oven overnight at 85*c OR for 5 hours at 160*c.
For the BBQ sauce; Blitz any cooking liquor and onions left in the gastro try with the BBQ sauce.
Brush on some of the BBQ sauce on the brisket and put back in the oven at 220 *c and caramelize for 5-10 min.
Serve with more BBQ sauce the wrap and sides (potato salad & coleslaw). COOKING TIPS: you can reduce the cooking liqour right down and add to the BBQ sauce for extra flavour and depth.

methodText: 1. For the rub; Mix all the spices sugar and salt together in a small bowl and set aside. 2. For the brisket; Trim down any think layers of fat then rub the spice rub all over the brisket. In a pot add 500ml water the tomato paste veg stock heat and whisk to incorporate. Place the brisket in a gastro tray fat side down with the roughly diced onion tomato stock and cover with a lid or foil. 3. Roast in the oven overnight at 85*c OR for 5 hours at 160*c. 4. For the BBQ sauce; Blitz any cooking liquor and onions left in the gastro try with the BBQ sauce. 5. Brush on some of the BBQ sauce on the brisket and put back in the oven at 220 *c and caramelize for 5-10 min. 6. Serve with more BBQ sauce the wrap and sides (potato salad & coleslaw). COOKING TIPS: you can reduce the cooking liqour right down and add to the BBQ sauce for extra flavour and depth.
